item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Well, these sad and hopeless obstacles are welcome in one sense, for they enable us to look with indifference upon the cruel satires that Fate loves to indulge in." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Thomas Hardy
item.description: "Backlock, a poet blind from his birth, could describe visual objects with accuracy; Professor Sanderson, who was also blind, gave excellent lectures on color, and taught others the theory of ideas which they had and he had not. In the social sphere these gifted ones are mostly women; they can watch a world which they never saw, and estimate forces of which they have only heard. We call it intuition." -- Thomas Hardy

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description:
"I wanted to see you again, touch you, know who you were, see if I would find you identical with the ideal image of you which had remained with me and perhaps shatter my dream with the aid of reality.
-Claude Frollo " -- Victor Hugo

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Robert F. Kennedy
item.description: "There are those that look at things the way they are, and ask why? I dream of things that never were, and ask why not?" -- Robert F. Kennedy

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "If a man is called to be a street sweeper, he should sweep streets even as a Michaelangelo painted, or Beethoven composed music or Shakespeare wrote poetry. He should sweep streets so well that all the hosts of heaven and earth will pause to say, 'Here lived a great street sweeper who did his job well." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is useless for me to describe to you how terrible Violet, Klaus, and even Sunny felt in the time that followed. If you have ever lost someone very important to you, then you already know how it feels, and if you haven't, you cannot possibly imagine it." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Eoin Colfer
item.description: "If I win, I'm a prodigy. If I lose, then I'm crazy. That's the way history is written." -- Eoin Colfer

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired." -- Robert Frost

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Life is a gamble, at terrible odds. If it were a bet you wouldnâ€™t take it." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Tom Stoppard
item.description: "Life in a box is better than no life at all, I expect. You'd have a chance at least. You could lie there thinking: Well, at least I'm not dead." -- Tom Stoppard

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "No man, for any considerable period, can wear one face to himself and another to the multitude, without finally getting bewildered as to which may be the true." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Rebecca West
item.description: "I myself have never been able to find out precisely what feminism is: I only know that people call me a feminist whenever I express sentiments that differentiate me from a doormat, or a prostitute." -- Rebecca West

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by AnaÃ¯s Nin
item.description: "I, with a deeper instinct, choose a man who compels my strength, who makes enormous demands on me, who does not doubt my courage or my toughness, who does not believe me naÃ¯ve or innocent, who has the courage to treat me like a woman." -- AnaÃ¯s Nin

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Quotation is a serviceable substitute for wit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by mark twain
item.description: "Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself." -- mark twain

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Keep away from people who try to belittle your ambitions. Small people always do that, but the really great make you feel that you, too, can become great." -- Mark Twain

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "From the moment I picked your book up until I laid it down, I convulsed with laughter. Someday I intend on reading it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Edmund Burke
item.description: "The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing." -- Edmund Burke

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Go to heaven for the climate and hell for the company." -- Mark Twain

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Some humans would do anything to see if it was possible to do it. If you put a large switch in some cave somewhere, with a sign on it saying 'End-of-the-World Switch. PLEASE DO NOT TOUCH', the paint wouldn't even have time to dry." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: M-m-maile add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf
